qas.question: What types of parks receive special protection against damage or degradation?
What is the goal of protecting National Parks from damage?

answers.text: with the objective of biodiversity and landscape conservation

qas.question: Who usually owns and manages National parks?
What activities are prohibited in national parks?

answers.text: Forestry operations, grazing of animals and hunting of animals

qas.question: What types of parks receive special protection against conservation?

plausible_answers.text: with the objective of biodiversity and landscape conservation

qas.question: What is the goal of protecting National Parks from roads?
Who usually owns and manages roads?

plausible_answers.text: Forestry operations, grazing of animals and hunting of animals

qas.question: What activities are prohibited on roads?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>National park and nature reserve<b5_0/><a0_0/> is the area selected by <a1_0><b6_0>governments or private organizations<b6_0/><a1_0/> for special protection against damage or degradation <a2_0><b7_0>with the objective of biodiversity and landscape conservation<b7_0/><a2_0/>. National parks are usually owned and managed by <a3_0><b8_0>national or state governments<b8_0/><a3_0/>. A limit is placed on the number of visitors permitted to enter certain fragile areas. Designated trails or roads are created. The visitors are allowed to enter only for study, cultural and recreation purposes. <a4_0><b9_0>Forestry operations, grazing of animals and hunting of animals<b9_0/><a4_0/> are prohibited. Exploitation of habitat or wildlife is banned.
